name: NPR
text:
Last month, the Ethiopian government launched a military offensive against a rebellious regional government. The ensuing conflict has killed hundreds, and almost 50,000 Ethiopians have crossed into Sudan.

Humanitarian workers are struggling to keep up.
https://t.co/h5TeVZUhJU

name: NPR
text: Opinion: It may seem elitist to worry about the future of the arts when so many people struggle for food, work and health care, @nprscottsimon says. But the arts can fire minds, warm souls, dazzle and delight. https://t.co/YzDKvdi7L8

name: NPR
text:
Economist Robert Reich served as secretary of labor under President Bill Clinton. @waitwait invited him to play "Secretary of Leisure" â€” 3 questions about things famous people do to relax.
https://t.co/VKjj912Ibj

name: NPR
text:
"Football players can get tests," one clinical pathologist said. "People choosing to socialize ... can get tests."

But a national program to test the nation's health care workers regularly? 

There isn't one.
https://t.co/J6DdqDMu4q

name: NPR
text:
After coming home from Iraq, Tyler's dad had nightmares so bad he feared closing his eyes. Tyler created a smartwatch app to detect their onset and disrupt them with a gentle vibration.

Now, it's FDA-approved to treat PTSD-related nightmare disorders. https://t.co/9o0z17Lx50

name: NPR
text:
The beloved Denver book chain Tattered Cover is the nation's largest Black-owned indie bookstore after its sale to a group of investors with businessman Kwame Spearman at its helm as CEO.
https://t.co/SOXwEsivCx

name: NPR
text: Charley Pride died at age 86 from complications of COVID-19 in Dallas. The baritone-voiced singer was the first Black man inducted into the Country Music Hall of Fame. https://t.co/DZLOiycAf1

name: NPR
text:
Nipsey Hussle was an advocate for the community where he grew up and constantly gave back to it. 

But the irony of his untimely death sheds light on the larger backdrop of inequality in his hood:

The phenomenon of mass supervision in Black communities. https://t.co/MduY9ugwhI

name: NPR
text:
Jewish families haven't always given presents on Hanukkah â€” it only dates to the 1880s. Arthur Levine's new children's book imagines a magical origin for the tradition. 

"I really wanted to add ... a mythological hero that Jews could call their own."
https://t.co/laGq6RHVDL

name: NPR
text: Jupiter and Saturn will form a Great Conjunction on Dec. 21 for the first time in nearly 400 years. This event will mark the closest the largest planets in our solar system have been since 1623. @hereandnow https://t.co/atixqoX6mZ

name: NPR
text:
Commentary: "Please, donâ€™t make us take care of your grandparents again," write six senior pediatric residents. 

"Weâ€™ll do it, because itâ€™s the right thing to do, to help in a crisis â€” but weâ€™re your last resort, your second string." @cogwbur https://t.co/J3TFQ8vbfY

name: NPR
text:
Watch Nashville singer-songwriter @AshleyRayMusic perform three songs from her celebrated album, 'Pauline,' for our special Tiny Desk quarantine series:
https://t.co/rwXIECHf0f

name: NPR
text: It's a scientific detective story: Years of research finally has pinpointed a chemical that leaves some salmon swimming around aimlessly until they die. The substance isn't manufactured anywhere, but instead is the result of tires slowly wearing out. @KUOW https://t.co/9QchYmh4jS

name: NPR
text: Thousands of Airbnb hosts received an email invitation to buy company stock ahead of its initial public offer. Many, though, didn't take the email seriously. https://t.co/RgrGi3MYwM

name: NPR
text: The number for the National Suicide Hotline appears all over, but less than a sixth of people in crisis reach out to it. Few people think of the number unless it's right in front of them, while others may be caught earlier by search engines. @WHYYThePulse https://t.co/2McCgAfWgs

name: NPR
text:
Gitanjali Rao's app for spotting and preventing cyberbullying uses AI to identify words and phrases online that could be considered bullying. The self-learning algorithm can pick up on the latest slang, emojis and memes. 

She explains it on @hereandnow:
https://t.co/0EbGDWyFyW

name: NPR
text:
Clashes between Proud Boys at the Million MAGA March and counterprotesters grew violent by nightfall. 

Of a total 8 people injured, at least 4 were reportedly stabbed. 

In all, at least 23 people were arrested in relation to the protests.
 
https://t.co/zI5xQZCfEg

name: NPR
text:
The distribution of Pfizer's COVID-19 vaccine is now underway â€” and the head of Operation Warp Speed expects there will be enough shipments of the two-dose vaccine to immunize 20 million people by the end of 2020.
 https://t.co/AZcd2emYJd

text: RT @asmamk: A person familiar with transition discussions told @FrancoOrdonez it was intentional that immigration wasnâ€™t included on the list of the top 4 priorities for the new administration. name: NPR
text:

But activists argue turning the clock back to the Obama years is not enough. https://t.co/QzknjSkMil
